item.title: All Pokémon Legends: Z-A Mega Evolutions & How to Get Them
item.content:encoded:
Mega Evolution has returned in Pokémon Legends: Z-A, with even more to unlock than ever before, and an array of different requirements are present before you can obtain them all.

Obtaining all the Mega Evolutions is a lengthy, but worthwhile, task in the bid to complete Mable’s Research Tasks, which provides the ultimate prize of a Shiny Charm, but you won’t be able to get them all until the post-game.

We’ve got all the requirements and Mega Evolutions in Pokémon Legends: Z-A detailed in this guide.

Mega Evolutions in Pokémon Legends: Z-A require obtaining a specific Pokémon’s Mega Evolution Stone, with several ways of obtaining them.

Many are locked behind story progression, with no way to jump ahead, while others can be obtained relatively early on, as long as you have enough cash or Mega Shards. Pokémon Legends: Z-A does make some even more difficult to obtain, however, locking them behind online ranked participation.

Here’s a quick breakdown of the many ways you can get Mega Evolution Stones in Pokémon Legends: Z-A

  • Story Progression
  • Stone Emporium
  • Quasartico Mega Shard Exchange
  • Mystery Gift Rewards
  • Ranked Battle Rewards
  • Post-Game Content

item.title: The Pokémon Company COO Calls For All Recent Pokémon Leaks & Pictures To Be Removed
item.content:encoded:
If you had any doubts over the legitimacy of the recent wave of gargantuan Pokémon leaks, then The Pokémon Company COO Takato Utsunomiya calling for them all to be removed is probably the most telling piece of evidence you can ask for.

October 13 saw a seismic influx of Pokémon leaks hit the internet. We learned about Generation 10’s Wind and Wave, a bunch of new Pokémon games, and the DLC Roadmap, not to mention potential Pokémon MMO Details!

It’s been a rip-roaring few days, and we don’t think The Pokémon Company has taken too kindly to it all.

Pokémon Wind & Wave And Other Leaks Asked To Be Taken Down

Centro LEAKS has become one of the go-to accounts in all of social media where Pokémon leaks are concerned. Some would argue it’s the account everyone refreshes. It posted a bunch of leaks ahead of Pokémon Legends Z-A, and it’s a regular source of Pokémon leaks for Pokémon Pocket and other associated media.

The page reported on October 16 that it had been contacted directly by The Pokémon Company.

“Mr. Takato Utsunomiya, the Chief Operating Officer of The Pokémon Company, has personally sent an email to Centro Leaks / X to take down the Pokémon leak images.”

Centro LEAKS has reiterated that it will not be removing any such leaks or images. In fact, the page has doubled down on its findings and revealed that among the images they want removed are the alleged Pokémon Wind and Wave logos.

The social media page has now pinned a message from Oct. 17, 2024, saying: “If only he knew that laws don’t exist in Perú.”

The message was presumably another instance of copyright issues between the page and The Pokémon Company, and it’s clear that Centro LEAKS’ stance won’t change in 2025. So, unless The Pokémon Company has something stronger in mind, Centro LEAKS will have all the original leaks on its page for the foreseeable future.

item.title: Original Dead Space Creator Is “Making Calls” And Eager To Develop Dead Space 4
item.content:encoded:
Dead Space 4 is a wishlist game for many survival-horror fans. Glen Schofield is the genius behind the original title, and while he didn’t have any direct involvement in its sequels, the creator wants to return and get horrible again with Dead Space 4.

It was almost a year ago that Schofield revealed EA turned down Dead Space 4. There’s a wide belief that the Dead Space Remake didn’t meet sales expectations for Krafton. This is likely why we haven’t heard a sniff about a Dead Space 2 Remake, let alone a fourth game. However, Schofield has reiterated his desire to return to the world of nail-biting terror and necromorphs.

Glen Schofield Wants To Make Dead Space 4

Schofield declared in an interview with IGN:

“I have quite a few ideas that I’m ready to go with, and one of them is Dead Space 4. The fact that EA just got bought, I think there’s an opportunity. I’m already making calls.”

He revisited his trip to EA, which we’ve already mentioned above, and doubled down on the fact that EA has seemingly moved on from Dead Space:

“I went to [EA] recently and they’re like no, we’re not interested anymore. I said, I can get back the leadership team. I need the models from EA Motive [Dead Space Remake creator] and I can save you 30 to 40 million dollars on the idea that I have. And, they’re like, ‘no.'”

The Dead Space creator believes the $55 billion takeover of EA could lead to some changes, though: “I am more optimistic because somebody new could buy [the rights to the Dead Space IP].”

EA did ask if fans were interested in more Dead Space Remakes shortly after the 2023 release. However, it appears that all plans are on hold for now. Would you like to see a Dead Space 2 Remake? Or can we go one better and finally get the Dead Space 4 sequel we’ve all been waiting for? Share your thoughts through the Insider Gaming Discord.

item.title: Former Call of Duty Director Says “None Of The Games Have Been Very Good” Since He Left
item.content:encoded:
Glen Schofield co-founded Sledgehammer Games and would later go on to become the CEO of Striking Distance Studios. But it’s at Sledgehammer where the director was able to flex his creative chops on Call of Duty: Modern Warfare 3, Advanced Warfare, and WWII.

Schofield left Sledgehammer in 2018, and new Call of Duty titles have appeared across multiple studios: Black Ops Cold War, Vanguard, the modern-day Modern Warfare Remakes, and new Black Ops games. The former Call of Duty director believes the quality of the games has diminished in recent years.

Glen Schofield Slams Current Call of Duty Era

“As a matter of fact, Modern Warfare 3 (his CoD directorial debut) was the last Call of Duty to win Action Game of the Year, and my other two games were nominated for it. But now, you know, you don’t see them.” Schofield said to VGC.

He was asked about the ‘Call of Duty machine’, and it operates now. The franchise continues to make ridiculous sums of money, but there’s constant criticism about the direction of games, their content, and many other issues.

The former director thinks that it hasn’t been the same since he left Sledgehammer and stopped having creative and directorial input into Call of Duty.

“I’ll give you one selfish example, I hate doing this, but since I left Sledgehammer, none of the games have been very good. I mean, the last one [Modern Warfare 3 (2023)] was a 50. They still sell well. They just aren’t as good. They aren’t the same. Treyarch’s still really good but you know…I got lucky. I feel like I was at the heyday of EA during my time there. I mean, it was a who’s who working there. And then when I got to Activision, I made Modern Warfare 3 (2011).”

Schofield is currently enjoying a break after leaving Striking Distance Studios, following the unsuccessful launch of The Callisto Protocol.

Do you agree that Call of Duty games haven’t gotten near the level of 2011’s Modern Warfare 3? Can CoD ever get back to these glorious heights? Let us know through the Insider Gaming Discord.

item.title: All Pokémon Legends: Z-A Mystery Gift Codes & Rewards
item.content:encoded:
Pokémon Legends: Z-A has plenty to discover and enjoy in Lumiose City, and there are special rewards available through the game’s Mystery Gift feature with specific codes.

With the return of Mega Evolution starring in Pokémon Legends: Z-A, bringing the likes of Mega Charizard and Mega Gyarados back into the fray alongside new Pokémon, any additional bonuses you can get your hands on can make a big difference in your pursuit of success.

If you’re on the hunt to make sure you don’t miss out on any Mystery Gift codes in Pokémon Legends: Z-A, we’ve got all the details you need.

Pokémon Legends: Z-A does not have any specific redeemable codes right now, but there are three rewards available in-game through the Mystery Gift function.

Since the game has just launched, it’s not surprising that there are not too many rewards available right now, with the only ones available being through purchases and pre-orders. Nevertheless, they’re important goodies to claim if you are entitled to them.

Additional Mystery Gift codes are likely to be made available in future, just like they have been in previous Pokémon titles like Scarlet & Violet. Previous rewards in those games included sandwich ingredients, cosmetic items, special event Pokémon, Pokéballs, and usable items.

A full list of the available rewards through Mystery Gifts in Pokémon Legends: Z-A is shown in the table below. Be sure to bookmark this page, as we’ll update any further rewards as soon as they become available.

To redeem codes and claim rewards, make sure your console is connected to the internet and you have progressed through the early parts of the story in Pokémon Legends: Z-A. We’ve got the full steps in the process outlined in this guide, in case you get stuck.
